By
Kirk Hamilton
4/04/18 2:40PM
Comments (198)

I play action games, RPGs, puzzle games, adventure games, and games from pretty much every other genre.', 'Instead, I categorize games by how they fit into my life.

Advertisement

I rarely think, "I\'m in the mood for a good action/adventure game right now."', 'mobile">

  • Everyone plays games differently, meaning that different games will doubtless be categorized differently for different people.', 'None of these are mutually exclusive.

1.', 'Some people rotate in fresh Mainstays every few months, but usually people keep a Mainstay in their lives for years at a time.

Advertisement

2.', 'While most games on your phone are in a "games" folder, the Time Waster is right there on your main screen.

Advertisement

3.', 'Playing it is like returning to a part of your past you\'ve otherwise left behind.

Advertisement

4.', 'iqioLK ad-unit ad-mobile">
Advertisement

5.', 'But you\'re mostly playing for the party chat.

Advertisement

6.', 'Point is, this is the game you break out when there\'s a crowd around.

Advertisement

7.', 'The Newsmaker is one example of how you don\'t have to play video games to be entertained by them.

Advertisement

8.', 'Sometimes a Newsmaker is also a Spectator Sport, but not necessarily.

Advertisement

9.', 'The downside of the Ego Boost is that occasionally, your plan to dip in for a quick win won\'t go as planned and you\'ll find yourself losing match after match and ruining your evening in the process.

Advertisement

10.', 'Maybe it\'s the dungeons in a Persona or Final Fantasy game, where you\'re sick of the music and there\'s no story or dialogue to miss.

Advertisement

11.', 'Eventually, you\'ll reinstall it.

Advertisement

12.', 'Those unsolved puzzles in The Witness can wait; you\'ve got another level of this middling 2008 FPS to get through.

Advertisement

13.', 'Palate Cleansers are usually really good games, and can easily become Faves.

Advertisement

14.', 'It\'s your job, only better.

Advertisement

15.', 'Mountaintop games tend to be all-or-nothing affairs: they completely take over your gaming life until you either beat them or lose your will to keep playing, at which point they quickly fade away.

Advertisement

16.', 'Even if you never wind up playing it, it\'s proof that you believe in your capacity to try new things.

Advertisement

Those categories are how I see things breaking down, but I\'m sure there are several viable categories and sub-categories that I didn\'t consider.', 'What types of games do you play, and how do you categorize them?

DISCUSSION

['biSEwE">The 16 Types Of Video Game
By
Kirk Hamilton

I play action games, RPGs, puzzle games, adventure games, and games from pretty much every other genre.', 'Instead, I categorize games by how they fit into my life.

Advertisement

I rarely think, "I\'m in the mood for a good action/adventure game right now."', 'More often, I\'ll think, "I just want a quick time-waster," or, "I\'ve got no plans tonight, time to put a few hours into my mainstay."

Below is a list of the major types of video game, as they pertain to our everyday lives.', 'mobile">

  • Everyone plays games differently, meaning that different games will doubtless be categorized differently for different people.', 'The Mainstay

    This is your "main" game.', 'The Mainstay is commonly a major MMO like World of Warcraft or Guild Wars 2, an MMO/action hybrid like Destiny or Monster Hunter, or a competitive game like CSGO, Dota or Overwatch.', 'The Time Waster

    Like the name suggests, the Time Waster is the game that you break out whenever you have a few minutes to kill.', 'While most games on your phone are in a "games" folder, the Time Waster is right there on your main screen.

    Advertisement
    The Fave is the beloved classic game that you replay every so often.', 'My own Faves have included Far Cry 2 and Half-Life 2, two mid-2000s games that I used to replay at least once a year.', 'The Traveler

    The Traveler is the game you only really play when you\'re on the go.', "Maybe it's a Switch port of a game you'd never play if you were at home and had more options, like Skyrim.", 'The Socialite (Online)

    The Socialite is a plenty fun game, but you\'re really playing it because that\'s where your friends are.', 'The Socialite (Local)

    The Local Socialite is a game you break out when you have people over and want to play something with them.', 'Point is, this is the game you break out when there\'s a crowd around.

    Advertisement
    The Newsmaker is the game you don\'t actually play, but you like to read about.', 'The Newsmaker is one example of how you don\'t have to play video games to be entertained by them.

    Advertisement
    You don\'t actually play this game either; you watch it.', 'The Ego Boost

    This is the competitive game that you play sporadically, usually when you\'re feeling low and want a quick victory fix.', "Maybe it's a building game like Minecraft or Dragon Quest Builders, or maybe it's just the grinding portions of your Mainstay, like WoW or Destiny.", 'Maybe it\'s the dungeons in a Persona or Final Fantasy game, where you\'re sick of the music and there\'s no story or dialogue to miss.

    Advertisement
    Sometimes you just like a game, even though it\'s not "good.', 'The Palate Cleanser

    Sometimes you want a substantive, interesting game to serve as a change of pace from the Time-Wasters and Mainstays in your life.', "Maybe it's a narrative game like Life is Strange, or a puzzle game like Monument Valley or an interesting co-op game like A Way Out.", 'Palate Cleansers are usually really good games, and can easily become Faves.

    Advertisement
    Some games are like jobs.', 'Some games are like your job.', 'If you run a small business or work in management, you may feel weird about spending your downtime organizing an operation in Game Dev Story or SimCity.', 'Souls games and their ilk, from Bloodborne to Nioh, most obviously fall into this category.', 'Mountaintop games tend to be all-or-nothing affairs: they completely take over your gaming life until you either beat them or lose your will to keep playing, at which point they quickly fade away.

    Advertisement
    This is the game you bought during a Steam sale that you swear you\'ll get to after you play all these other games.', 'What types of games do you play, and how do you categorize them?

    DISCUSSION

I rarely think, "I\'m in the mood for a good action/adventure game right now."', 'More often, I\'ll think, "I just want a quick time-waster," or, "I\'ve got no plans tonight, time to put a few hours into my mainstay."

Below is a list of the major types of video game, as they pertain to our everyday lives.', 'M-Series 4K UHD Smart TV" data-anim-src=""/>

Save $200
Vizio 70" M-Series 4K UHD Smart TV

Treat your eyes!
Butter-smooth handling, gorgeous visuals, and a 700-nit peak brightness rating.

Let\'s do this.

1.', 'The Mainstay

This is your "main" game.', 'The Time Waster

Like the name suggests, the Time Waster is the game that you break out whenever you have a few minutes to kill.', 'The Fave

The Fave is the beloved classic game that you replay every so often.', 'The Traveler

The Traveler is the game you only really play when you\'re on the go.', 'The Socialite (Online)

The Socialite is a plenty fun game, but you\'re really playing it because that\'s where your friends are.', 'The Socialite (Local)

The Local Socialite is a game you break out when you have people over and want to play something with them.', 'The Newsmaker

The Newsmaker is the game you don\'t actually play, but you like to read about.', 'The Spectator Sport

You don\'t actually play this game either; you watch it.', 'The Ego Boost

This is the competitive game that you play sporadically, usually when you\'re feeling low and want a quick victory fix.', 'The Podcaster

The Podcaster is what you play while you listen to podcasts (or rewatch an old TV show, or catch up on YouTube videos, etc.).', 'The Bad Habit

You don\'t like The Bad Habit, but you can\'t quit playing it.', 'The Guilty Pleasure

Sometimes you just like a game, even though it\'s not "good.', 'The Palate Cleanser

Sometimes you want a substantive, interesting game to serve as a change of pace from the Time-Wasters and Mainstays in your life.', 'The Second Job

Some games are like jobs.', 'The Mountaintop

Occasionally you just want a challenge.', 'The Maybe-Someday

This is the game you bought during a Steam sale that you swear you\'ll get to after you play all these other games.', 'important;text-align:center" data-css-selector="ad-container.ad-mobile">

Those categories are how I see things breaking down, but I\'m sure there are several viable categories and sub-categories that I didn\'t consider.', 'The Sunk Cost

The game is garbage, ']
